items.content_html:
This is part of #6108.

We are dealing with features that are no more on the standard track (deprecated), with bcd tables. The idea is to remove the {{Specifications}}, that implies missing data in this case, without putting back an outdated table like before

Dealing with the RTCRtpTransceiver.stopped and RTCSessionDescriptiion.

  • I removed the {{Specifications}} macro and replaced it with a basic text.
  • I moved near the top the main explaination why stopped has been deprecated.

I removed some gremlins too.

items.content_html:
I made two changes to the page about TypedArray.prototype.slice().

  1. Reworded a sentence from "add an element" to "change an element", because new elements can't be added to Typed Arrays
  2. Replaced Array.prototype with TypedArray.prototype, as this page is about the latter.
items.title: Minor clarity improvements in the page about TypedArray.slice()

items.title: HTML Element page template - update for browser-compat

items.title: Updated the incomplete description of TypeError

items.content_html:
I went a bit of rabbit hole here: initially I just wanted to fix two <h2> that weren't showing because of a useless <div>. (I detected this while checking the new spec table).

Finally:

  • I added the missing sidebars
  • Removed the gremlins
  • Corrected a couple of grammar errors.

Nothing big.
items.title: Minor editorial and grammar fixes for Credential APIs

items.content_html:
This is part of #6108.

We are dealing with features that are no more on the standard track (deprecated), with bcd tables. The idea is to remove the {{Specifications}}, that implies some data is missing on mdn/browser-spec-data, without putting back an outdated table like before.

Here I deal with one WebVR property Gamepad.displayId that is not the most typical one as gamepads are excluded of the fundamental WebXR Display API specification, and:

  • I added a note at the top;
  • I replaced {{Specification}} with a more adequate text.

There are a lot more pages (~70 pages) about WebVR on MDN and I would like to do something similar (but not a cut & paste: minor adaptations each time). Before proceeding with these pages, I would like a careful review of one adaptation (here!), so that I don't redo the work several times.

@dontcallmedom , I think you are quite active on immersive-web, so I'm interested in your feedback (but not only yours).
items.title: Update no-spec msg for Gamepad.displayId

items.content_html:
I can find no record that the MutationObserver article ever actually had a “Monitoring text content changes” section, and no record that existed anywhere else in MDN at any time.

Fixes #6150
items.title: Drop link to non-existent “Monitoring text content changes” section

items.title: Make comment match actual function names

items.content_html:
Adds the HIDConnectionEvent interface.

Reviewer @jpmedley
items.title: Adds HIDConnectionEvent

items.content_html:
This change replaces the ad-hoc “JSON syntax” formalism in the main article on JSON with instead the standard ABNF grammar from the standard RFC that normatively defines JSON.

Otherwise, without this change, we continue to have a formalism in that article that’s not in any known/standard language for expressing a set of productions for a grammar — and that apparently has a least on bug that’s in conflict with the normative grammar.

Fixes #5909
items.title: Replace ad-hoc JSON formalism w/ standard ABNF in JSON doc

items.content_html:
Adds HIDInputReportEvent.

Reviewer @jpmedley
items.title: Adds HIDInputReportEvent

items.content_html:
This updates DPR HTTP header with directives section, and additional info from the last spec I can find in which it was mentioned (in the next version there is info that says headers were removed to their own specs, but I cannot yet find.

It also adds info about using Vary, and what happens if the value appears multiple times in response. That's from the spec.

I removed info about Accept-CH-Lifetime from this page, as that header is deprecated.

This is part of addressing #1408 and follows on from #5883.

  • BCD work to test if all client hints should have the secure header tagging here: mdn/browser-compat-data#11144
  • BCD work to mark headers deprecated here: mdn/browser-compat-data#11186

@Elchi3 Feel free to review/merge this. If you don't, I'll continue to add the other device client hints docs until done. But hoping for sanity check. Note, I'm also after advice on how to find the spec for this.
items.title: Update device client hint information

items.content_html: This PR is a work in progress, proof-of-concept PR to remove ConstrainDouble from MDN web docs. The documentation is not complete, as this is intended to get an idea of what to do for this, and the other, typedefs. Part of work for #5975.
items.title: Remove ConstrainDouble
